intro: Penicillaria arabica, commonly known as the Arabian penicillaria, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Due to its medicinal properties and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in drought-tolerant gardens.
